intro: Agoseris pumila, commonly known as the dwarf agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, yellow to pale green composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it thrives in dry, rocky soils. Agoseris pumila is often found in coastal and inland grasslands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
